intro: Hieracium guilhotii, commonly known as the Guilhot's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium guilhotii is often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
